title: Making an animation using powerpoint
materials_required: Microsoft Office Powerpoint (MUST HAVE 2007 or higher)
Windows Movie Maker (Comes with Windows XP)
description: This project guides you through the process of creating a simple animation using Microsoft Powerpoint. Optionally, you can also create a video of the animation using Windows Movie Maker.
steps: Create your character in parts using Photoshop or Paint. If using Photoshop, apply stroke and bevel effects.
If using Paint, skip this step. If using Photoshop, copy each part into a new file, make the unwanted part transparent, and save each part as a .gif file.
Run Powerpoint and delete any existing content on the slide. Set the slide background to match your image's background.

If you used Paint, copy and paste each character part onto the slide and assemble the character, copying the pant 4 times, and arm and hand twice. If you used Photoshop, insert each part as a picture and assemble the character in Powerpoint, copying the pant 4 times, and arm and hand twice.
In Powerpoint, go to the Animations tab, uncheck 'on mouse click', and check 'automatically after'. Set the time to 00:00.12 and apply to all slides.

Duplicate the current slide by right-clicking on the slide preview and dragging down while pressing copy. Change the character's pose slightly in the new slide and repeat until you have at least 36 frames.
Select the first frame and run the slideshow to preview the animation.
To create a video, press F12 in Powerpoint to save the frames as JPEG files.
Open Movie Maker, go to Tools > Options > Advanced and change the picture duration to 0.125 seconds.
Import the JPEG frames into Movie Maker and arrange them on the timeline in sequential order. Add music and save the project as a movie file.
